sections.name: Fading Fox
sections.text: With fur that shifts between hues of red, dull brown, and silver as it moves, the fading fox vexes any pursuer. It has a knack for escaping traps, leaves no footprints, and seemingly disappears into thin air. Fading foxes have lustrous fur and a robust build that set them apart from their red fox progenitors.

sections.name: Fox
Noble Quarry
sections.text: In Taldor, the hunt is an ancient institution steeped in ceremony. For Taldan nobles, the hunt and its pageantry offer a chance to showcase martial skill and wealth while reaffirming tradition and etiquette. Alliances are forged and political maneuvering happens around the post-hunt banquet table, so a successful hunt is of paramount importance. To this end, Taldan game wardens have spent centuries using selective breeding and magic to raise new species of boars, foxes, stags, and other quarry that share the most sought-after traits of their forebears and offer the best sport. Despite resistance from druidic orders and the damage to crops and livestock these creatures cause, the practice is sanctioned by royal decree.
Elusive and shrewd, foxes have gained a reputation as sly tricksters, earning them a place in many folk tales.

traits.name: Tiny
traits.text: *Space:* Less than 5 feet, *Reach (Tall):* 0 feet, *Reach (Long):* 0 feet.  Multiple Tiny creatures can occupy the same square.  At least four can fit in a single square, though the GM might determine that even more can fit.  Tiny creatures can occupy a space larger creature as well, and if their reach is 0 feet, they must do so in order to attack.

traits.name: Animal
traits.text: An animal is a creature with a relatively low intelligence. It typically doesn’t have an Intelligence attribute modifier over –4, can’t speak languages, and can’t be trained in Intelligence-based skills.

modifiers.name: +7 to High Jump or Long Jump

automatic_abilities.name: Fade Away
automatic_abilities.trigger: A creature within 30 feet that the fading fox is aware of either moves toward the fox or targets it with an ability

automatic_abilities.name: Requirements
automatic_abilities.effect: The fading fox Hides. If its Stealth check result meets or exceeds the triggering creature's Perception DC, the fading fox is hidden to that creature. The fading fox can use this reaction even if it is being observed.
automatic_abilities.text: The fading fox is in natural surroundings;

traits.name: Agile
traits.text: The multiple attack penalty you take with this weapon on the second attack on your turn is –4 instead of –5, and –8 instead of –10 on the third and subsequent attacks in the turn.

traits.name: Finesse
traits.text: You can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier on attack rolls using this melee weapon. You still calculate damage using Strength.

ability.name: Leaping Pounce
ability.text: The fading fox either Strides or Leaps up to its Speed and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the fox began this action hidden, it remains hidden until after this ability's Strike.

ability.name: Sneak Attack
ability.text: The fading fox deals an additional 1d6 precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

universal_monster_ability.name: Sneak Attack
universal_monster_ability.text: When the monster Strikes a creature that has the flat-footed condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals the listed precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.

ability.name: Trackless Step
ability.text: The fading fox always gains the benefits of Cover Tracks in natural surroundings, even while moving at full Speed.

ability.name: Vanish into the Wilds
ability.requirement: The fading fox is in natural surroundings
ability.effect: The fading fox Steps, then Hides, then Sneaks. It can take this Step into natural difficult terrain and can Hide in this way even if it is being observed.
